intro: Camellia cucphuongensis, commonly known as the Cuc Phuong camellia, is a species native to Vietnam. It is a flowering plant in the Theaceae family, characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, camellia-like flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions, preferring shaded and moist environments. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces elliptical, dark brown seeds. Camellia cucphuongensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential horticultural value.
